tutorial.title: Growing Flex Items
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to make flex items grow to fit their containers.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent:
Let's learn how to use the properties of flex items to make them grow inside their container.

To see how the first flex item can grow to the size of its container, use the buttons to toggle the use of the property flex-grow.

lessons.title: Normal
lessons.interactiveContent:
To control how a flex item grows across its main axis, we use flex-grow inside a flex item rule.

Make sure to pick flex-grow.

lessons.title: Default value
lessons.interactiveContent:
The default value for flex-grow is 0, That means that the item doesn't adapt in size at all and is only as wide as its content. Code 0.

Make sure to type 0.

lessons.title: Grow
lessons.interactiveContent:
To make an item grow, we set flex-grow to 1.

Make sure to type 1.

lessons.title: Biggest number
lessons.interactiveContent:
Here, the first flex item has flex-grow: 1;, while the second defaults to 0. The one with the bigger number gets the most space.

Make sure to pick 1.

lessons.title: Container space
lessons.interactiveContent:
Items with bigger flex-grow values get more of the empty space left inside the container. A smaller container means they get less space.

Make sure to pick width followed by : and then 60%, ;.

lessons.title: Try it out
lessons.interactiveContent: Use the buttons to change the flex-direction and flex-grow properties to see how it affects the first flex item.

lessons.title: Question: Normal
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does the flex-grow property do?

It controls how a flex item grows across the main axisIt controls how a flex item grows in height and width

It controls how a flex item grows across the main axis.

lessons.title: Question: Default value
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the default flex-grow value?

0auto

Make sure to pick 0.

lessons.title: Question: Grow
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which value makes a flex item grow?

1100%

Make sure to pick 1.

lessons.title: Question: Biggest number
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which flex items can have a flex-grow property.

Any and all flex itemsOnly one flex item

Any and all flex items.

lessons.title: Question: Container space
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we set flex-grow to 1?

The flex item can grow as much as there's empty space in the containerThe flex item doubles in size

The flex item can grow as much as there's empty space in the container.

lessons.title: Example: Normal
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the flex-grow property.

Make sure to type flex-grow.

lessons.title: Example: Default
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the default flex-grow value, 0.

Make sure to type 0.

lessons.title: Example: Grow
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the flex item of class .home grow, by coding the value 1.

Make sure to pick 1.

lessons.title: Example: Biggest number
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the values so that only the flex item of class .about grows.

Make sure to pick 0, followed by 1.

lessons.title: Example: Container space
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make both flex items grow equally and set a container size of 200px.

Make sure to pick 1, followed by 1, and finally 200px.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent:
Let's learn to use flex-grow on multiple flex items.

Press the different buttons to see how flex-grow changes how much the first flex item can grow compared to the other flex items.

lessons.title: All grow
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can set flex-grow for all items inside a flex container. If we set all of them to 1, they grow equal in size and fill out the container.

Make sure to pick 1, followed by 1, and finally 1.

lessons.title: Any number
lessons.interactiveContent:
The values we set for flex-grow are ratios. If we set flex-grow to the same number for all items, they'll stay equal in size.

Make sure to pick 100, followed by 100, and finally 100.

lessons.title: More space
lessons.interactiveContent:
If we want to make the first flex item bigger, we give it a bigger flex-grow value than the other two items.

Make sure to pick 2, followed by 1, and finally 1.

lessons.title: Higher
lessons.interactiveContent:
The higher the number, the bigger the ratio of a container's empty space we give a flex item.

Make sure to pick 20.

lessons.title: Different ratios
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can set different ratios to provide different sizes for each flex item. To make each item bigger than the previous one, add 1, 2, and 3.

Make sure to pick 1, followed by 2, and finally 3.

lessons.title: Try it out
lessons.interactiveContent: Try out different flex directions and flex-grow values to see more of how it works.

lessons.title: Question: All grow
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we set all flex items inside a container to flex-grow: 1;.

They all grow equal in size and fill the containerThey all grow to the flex-basis value

They all grow equal in size and fill the container.

lessons.title: Question: Any number
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we set all flex items inside a container to flex-grow: 100;.

They all grow equal in size and fill the containerThey overflow the container

They all grow equal in size and fill the container.

lessons.title: Question: More space
lessons.interactiveContent:
How do we make a flex item grow more than another?

By giving it a bigger flex-grow valueBy giving it a smaller flex-grow value

By giving it a bigger flex-grow value.

lessons.title: Question: Higher
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we set a bigger flex-grow value?

We give the flex item a bigger ratio of a container's empty spaceThe flex item has a bigger size in percentages

We give the flex item a bigger ratio of a container's empty space.

lessons.title: Question: Different ratios
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which flex items have the same flex-grow value?

Items 1 and 2Items 1, 2, and 3

Items 1 and 2.

lessons.title: Example: All grow
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make all flex items grow the same amount.

Make sure to pick 1, followed by 1, and finally 1.

lessons.title: Example: Any number
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make all flex items grow the same amount.

Make sure to pick 5, followed by 5, and finally 5.

lessons.title: Example: More space
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the values so that the second flex item is bigger and the other two items are equal.

Make sure to pick 1, followed by 3, and finally 1.

lessons.title: Example: Higher
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the values so that the first and second items are the same size and the third item is the biggest size it can be.

Make sure to pick 1, followed by 1, and finally 10.

lessons.title: Example: Different ratios
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the values so that the flex items start off big and get smaller at the end.

Make sure to pick 5, followed by 3, and finally 1.
